page.title: 01BARLASTON-HOME LIFE
page.content: In BARLASTON Meadowcourt provides sheltered council accommodation for about 40 elderly people.There is a warden on duty during the weekand she also visits each person every morning.Until recently there was also an assistant warden to relieve the warden and provide round the clock cover,but the council has now removed this postin an effort to reduce costs,and instead each flat has been fitted with an intercom linked to a central exchange at Stafford. The majority of the flats consist of a living room,bedroom,small kitchen and a lavatory with wash basin.The tennants have to take their own furniture and are expected to be able to look after themselves.The system provides the independence and privacy that most old people want with the knowledge that help is close by.
